channel.title: [Almost Deleted My HardDrive C:]
channel.description:
So, im messing around made a bunch of java projects, well i decided to copy my "KillClass.bat" file over to my new stopWatch java project:
Edit: now looking at the picture, it wiped just a few files out in the recycle bins recycle bin?
KillClass.bat [code] @echo off @color 0a @title kill_class.bat
:main mode 50,100 del "/*.class"/Q /S :end exit [/code]
LITTLE DID I KNOW, it started wiping all the damn .class files in my Local Disk C: directory, wiped like... 700++ files in a few seconds, than i killed the batch file.
Pictures of my gayness + panick on chatbox....
Edit: this is a short logging picture, because i decided to run the KillClass.bat file again, since last time i ran it and panicked i seen (Recycle bin) thought running it again would do no harm: [IMG]http://i951.photobucket.com/albums/ad355/rspsman/epicfailure.png[/img]
Still no reply.... [IMG]http://i951.photobucket.com/albums/ad355/rspsman/failure.png[/img]
WOW. Reply, if you would like... or just laugh, im still grinning. (HEY worked fine in my other java folder...)

item.title: [Almost Deleted My HardDrive C:]
item.dc:creator: @purestmage74 purestmage74
item.description:
@purestmage74 wrote:

Thanks for the fancy batch file writing though:

@echo off
color a
:index
title Kill Class batch
echo Do You want to delete all class files from this directory?

set /p opt=Option:
if %opt%==yes goto yes
if %opt%==no goto end
if %opt%==* goto er

goto er
:er
goto :index
pause
cls

goto yes
:yes
echo Deleting...
del "./*.class"
echo Done!
exit

Probably use it for other stoofs.

Read full topic

item.title: [Almost Deleted My HardDrive C:]
item.dc:creator: @purestmage74 purestmage74
item.description:
@purestmage74 wrote:

Ok, if i got folders inside of folders with java files and class files, i like to:

  1. Wipe all the .class files out with a batch file so when i use my copier.bat to move my class files back in the proper positions so i can run my java files, just much easier, saves me the time of pressing “y” a couple times and having to overwrite.

  2. I set it to ping and exit with a 4 second countdown because i run that, after it deletes, i run the class copier, that exits, than i simply run my program, (With out having to click x or a key to exit classkill.bat).

:}

Read full topic

item.title: [Almost Deleted My HardDrive C:]
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[quote=“purestmage74, post:3, topic:421246”]YES I AM.
I don’t know why, but right before i ran it, i was like hmm what if it wiped out my hard drive, because i failed writing the batch file the first time so it printed “cant find files in C:”.

So lucky…
I fixed it now!

@echo off
@color 0a
@title kill_class.bat

:main
echo Deleting all .class files IN THIS directory...
PING -n 3 127.0.0.1>nul
del "./*.class"
PING -n 3 127.0.0.1>nul
echo Complete...
:end
echo Closing in 4 seconds...
PING -n 4 127.0.0.1>nul
echo Closing in 3 seconds...
PING -n 3 127.0.0.1>nul
echo Closing in 2 seconds...
PING -n 2 127.0.0.1>nul
echo Closing in 1 second...
PING -n 1 127.0.0.1>nul
exit

Im lazy so i made it just exit within 4 seconds instead of auto exit = wtf did it do??
Yes im pinging myself to create a Thread.sleep(time);[/quote]
Batch files are created to run things faster and u put in PING
??? wtf tryin to look cool?

@echo off
color a
title Kill Class
:main
echo Deleting all .class files IN THIS directory...
del "./*.class"
echo Complete...
:end
exit

Much better

And if u want it to look cool then use options

[code]
@echo off
color a
:index
title Kill Class batch
echo Do You want to delete all class files from this directory?

set /p opt=Option:
if %opt%==yes goto yes
if %opt%==no goto end
if %opt%==* goto er

goto er
:er
goto :index
pause
cls

goto yes
:yes
echo Deleting…
del “./*.class”
echo Done!
exit[/code]

Read full topic

@purestmage74 wrote:

YES I AM.
I don’t know why, but right before i ran it, i was like hmm what if it wiped out my hard drive, because i failed writing the batch file the first time so it printed “cant find files in C:”.

So lucky…
I fixed it now!

@echo off
@color 0a
@title kill_class.bat

:main
echo Deleting all .class files IN THIS directory...
PING -n 3 127.0.0.1>nul
del "./*.class"
PING -n 3 127.0.0.1>nul
echo Complete...
:end
echo Closing in 4 seconds...
PING -n 4 127.0.0.1>nul
echo Closing in 3 seconds...
PING -n 3 127.0.0.1>nul
echo Closing in 2 seconds...
PING -n 2 127.0.0.1>nul
echo Closing in 1 second...

exit

Im lazy so i made it just exit within 4 seconds instead of auto exit = wtf did it do??
Yes im pinging myself to create a Thread.sleep(time);

So, im messing around made a bunch of java projects, well i decided to copy my “KillClass.bat” file over to my new stopWatch java project:

KillClass.bat
